== Necrophilia in the fiction ==
While not necrophilia, [[Romanticism | romantic]] connections between [[romantic love | love]] and [[death]] are a frequent theme in [[Western_culture | Western]] [[art]]istic expression.
While not necrophilia, [[Romanticism | romantic]] connections between [[romantic love | love]] and [[death]] are a frequent theme in [[Western_culture | Western]] [[art]]istic expression.
*In the Greek legend of the [[Trojan War]], the Greek hero [[Achilles]] slays the [[Amazons|Amazon]] queen [[Penthesilea]] in a duel. Upon removing her helmet and seeing her face, Achilles falls in love with her and mourns her death. The soldier [[Thersites]] openly ridicules Achilles and accuses him of necrophilia. Achilles responds by promptly killing Thersites with a single blow. ''(In some traditions, Thersites' accusation is not unfounded--Achilles was so stricken by Panthesilea's beauty that he could not control his lust for her, even after her death.)''
